alert.note: Alert for Tallapoosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 12 at 1:30PM CST until January 12 at 2:30PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...TORNADO EMERGENCY FOR Alexander City and Wind Creek State Park... ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM CST FOR NORTHERN TALLAPOOSA COUNTY... At 129 PM CST, a confirmed large and destructive tornado was located over Highway 9 and Highway 22, or near Equality, moving northeast at 55 mph. TORNADO EMERGENCY for Alexander City and Wind Creek State Park. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. TAKE COVER NOW! HAZARD...Deadly tornado. SOURCE...Weather spotters confirmed tornado. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be destroyed. Considerable damage to homes, businesses, and vehicles is likely and complete destruction is possible. Locations impacted include... Alexander City, Dadeville, Jacksons` Gap, New Site, Hillabee Creek, Northern Lake Martin, Wind Creek State Park, Eastern Lake Martin, Western Lake Martin, Daviston, Horseshoe Bend National Military Park, Eagle Creek and Horseshoe Bend. TORNADO...OBSERVED TORNADO DAMAGE THREAT...CATASTROPHIC MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a large, extremely dangerous, and potentially deadly tornado is on the ground. To protect your life, TAKE COVER NOW! Move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If in a mobile home, a vehicle or outdoors, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
